instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message:
Liquid damaged dotted around the board

C7526 & C7525 we're burnt to a crisp when I got it replaced them and it cleared the short on that rail
Replaced ISL and ran a jumper from ISL pin28 to c7020. current sense resistors all measure ok.

G3h 12.59v

R7005 checks out
L7260 600 ohms to gnd
L7220 600 ohms to gnd

pp3v3_s5 3v
pp5v_s5 0v   - 4Mohms gnd

Any ideas?

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: 5V_S5 really 0V or you mean 5V_S3? EN pin on U7200 high?

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message:
yeah 5v_s5 is 0v i measured at c7273

p5vs3_entrip is 0v
p3v3s5_entrip 0.7v

edit: just measured c7273 again and now seem to be getting a fluctuating value 1.3-5v

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: SMC_PM_G2_EN makes 5V3V3_REG_EN and enables both 3v3 and 5V LDOs from U7200. So if both signals are there the LDOs should be working or U7200 is dead.

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: 5v_s5 is now stable, replaced isl and still same symptoms

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: Why did you replace the ISL? Why is 5V_S5 stable now? If PPBUS is 12.6V then 3v3_s5 should be present too.

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: I mean 7200 sorry, 3v3_s5 is present and stable but still no 5v_s3

threads.title: 820-3115 blinking greenlight
threads.message: Check for short pulses on 5V_S3, best to do with scope, multimeter are to slow. Also check 32KHz from clock chip and crap under SMC.
